tournament.name: MTG SEA Championship Final Season 2 Round 2  - Oracle Events

decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing powerful aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, supported by Leyline cards to provide additional bonuses and protection. The deck includes a variety of different land types in order to maximize the effect of Tribal Flames, which can deal significant damage to the opponent. With a mix of counterspells and removal, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently, utilizing a mix of creature aggression and spell control to secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Fallaji Archaeologist. With the help of Atraxa, Grand Unifier, Solitude, and Grief, the deck can disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition. Ephemerate and Tainted Indulgence provide additional ways to bring back creatures from the graveyard. The deck also includes removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Thoughtseize to control the board. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to efficiently reanimate creatures and disrupt the opponent's strategy to secure a win.

The deck focuses on utilizing Cascade mechanics to consistently cast powerful spells for free, overwhelming the opponent with a constant stream of threats. By chaining Cascade spells like Violent Outburst and Crashing Footfalls, the deck aims to bring in multiple creatures quickly and efficiently. Cards like Shardless Agent and Tishana's Tidebinder provide additional value through card advantage and disruption. The deck is designed to be aggressive and proactive, with the ability to generate a lot of tempo and pressure early in the game.

This deck aims to quickly equip creatures with powerful equipment like Colossus Hammer and Kaldra Compleat to deal massive damage in a short amount of time. It utilizes cards like Esper Sentinel and Puresteel Paladin to draw cards and generate additional mana, enabling the combo pieces to come together efficiently. With the support of cards like Sigarda's Aid and Urza's Saga, this deck can assemble its combo pieces quickly and overwhelm opponents with its aggressive strategy. The inclusion of cards like Shadowspear and Forge Anew provides additional versatility and resilience to the deck.

This deck focuses on aggressively casting spells with Cascade and creating an overwhelming board presence. By using cards that allow for Cascade such as Shardless Agent and Violent Outburst, the deck aims to quickly put powerful creatures like Scion of Draco and Crashing Footfalls into play for a quick victory. The deck also includes cards like Subtlety and Force of Negation for disruption, along with Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding for additional protection. Overall, the deck is built to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive strategy utilizing Cascade mechanics.

This deck focuses on quickly casting powerful spells with Cascade ability, utilizing Shardless Agent and Violent Outburst to cheat out big threats like Scion of Draco and Crashing Footfalls. The deck also includes cards like Subtlety and Tishana's Tidebinder to control the board state. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding provide additional synergy and protection for the deck. The mana base includes a variety of lands to ensure consistent casting of spells, with Gemstone Caverns and Boseiju, Who Endures providing unique advantages. Aggressive playstyle combined with Cascade mechanics is the core strategy of this deck.

The deck revolves around quickly putting powerful creatures into play from the graveyard, using a combination of instant spells and reanimation effects. By utilizing cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker, the deck aims to cheat out high-impact creatures such as Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier early in the game to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Supreme Verdict to control the board, while also incorporating cards like Ephemerate and Reprieve for protection and card advantage. The mana base is designed to support the various color requirements of the deck's spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by countering and removing threats while drawing extra cards with Narset, Parter of Veils and filtering through the library with Preordain. The key win condition is utilizing The One Ring to create a powerful artifact creature and protect it with counterspells and removal spells. The deck also includes cards like Teferi, Time Raveler to control the opponent's spells and Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion for additional synergy. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and secure victory through controlling the board and overwhelming with a powerful creature.

The deck focuses on quickly dropping efficient creatures and using powerful spells to control the board and deal damage to the opponent. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion provides additional mana ramp and flexibility. The main goal is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, while also being able to protect your threats with counterspells. The mana base is optimized to support the diverse color requirements of the deck, allowing for consistent plays and a fast-paced gameplay style.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful land-based combo pieces, such as Primeval Titan and Urza's Saga. It utilizes cards like Azusa, Lost but Seeking and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove to accelerate land drops and generate value. The inclusion of Amulet of Vigor helps to untap lands and generate even more mana. By utilizing land synergies and efficient ramp, the deck aims to set up explosive turns where it can tutor for key pieces and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures and lands.

This deck focuses on quickly casting spells with the Cascade ability to overwhelm your opponent with powerful creatures and disruptive spells. By chaining together Cascade triggers, you can rapidly flood the board with creatures like Scion of Draco and Crashing Footfalls. Leyline cards provide additional support by increasing the power of your spells. The deck also includes a mix of lands to ensure you have the right mana available at all times. Overall, the strategy is to consistently apply pressure and disrupt your opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing a variety of creatures with abilities that work well together, creating a toolbox of options for different situations. The key strategy involves using creatures like Young Wolf and Wall of Roots to generate mana, while also using creatures like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Grist, the Hunger Tide to control the board and manipulate the opponent's resources. The deck also includes combo pieces like Agatha's Soul Cauldron and Chord of Calling to quickly assemble powerful combinations. The overall goal is to overwhelm the opponent through a versatile and synergistic creature-based strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly building up a board of artifact creatures and using Hardened Scales to maximize their +1/+1 counters. The deck includes cards like Arcbound Ravager, Walking Ballista, and Hangarback Walker to take advantage of this synergy. Urza's Saga is used to tutor for key artifacts, while Zabaz, the Glimmerwasp and Patchwork Automaton provide additional support. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a growing army of powerful creatures while also using cards like The Ozolith and Agatha's Soul Cauldron to ensure resilience and longevity in the matchup.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay by utilizing a mix of efficient removal spells, disruptive hand disruption, and powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Ragavan. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion allows for additional mana fixing and flexibility in deck construction. The deck aims to apply early pressure, disrupt the opponent's game plan with targeted removal and hand disruption, and close out the game quickly with powerful threats. The combination of aggressiveness and disruption helps maintain tempo and control of the game.

The deck aims to quickly cycle through creatures with cards like Street Wraith and Curator of Mysteries, eventually filling the graveyard with big creatures like Oliphaunt and Waker of Waves. It looks to cast Living End to bring all these creatures back onto the battlefield, overwhelming the opponent with a powerful board presence. The deck includes disruption with cards like Force of Negation and Grief to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also including some control elements like Subtlety to deal with threats on the battlefield. Overall, the deck focuses on comboing off with Living End to win the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing The Underworld Cookbook along with various artifacts to generate card advantage and create powerful synergies. By combining cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Ovalchase Daredevil with the Cookbook, players can quickly overwhelm opponents with aggressive plays and efficient resource management. The inclusion of Academy Manufactor enhances the deck's ability to create multiple artifacts, while cards like Time Sieve and Mishra's Bauble provide additional utility and combo potential. Overall, this deck leverages aggressive strategies and artifact synergy to create a fast-paced and powerful gameplay experience.

This deck focuses on fast-paced, aggressive plays with a mixture of creature and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion adds an extra layer of flexibility to the deck. The creatures in the deck have a variety of abilities and offer a range of power levels to keep the pressure on the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the multiple color requirements of the spells in the deck, allowing for consistent casting of powerful spells throughout the game.

The deck aims to quickly assemble the Amulet of Vigor with lands like Gruul Turf and Simic Growth Chamber to generate mana and play Primeval Titan to fetch powerful lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and The Mycosynth Gardens. The One Ring can also help ramp up mana production. The deck includes cards like Dryad of the Ilysian Grove and Cultivator Colossus for additional ramp and utility. Boseiju, Who Endures offers protection for key spells, while Urza's Saga can tutor for important artifacts. Overall, the deck focuses on fast mana production and powerful land synergies to overwhelm the opponent.

The main idea of this deck is to cast cheap spells with Cascade and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Scion of Draco and Crashing Footfalls. The deck also utilizes Leyline cards to control the board and Leyline of the Guildpact to support the multicolored nature of the deck. By utilizing the Cascade mechanic and aggressive creatures, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game and close out the game quickly. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Force of Negation provides protection against opposing spells.

The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive creatures and powerful cascade spells, focusing on creating a board presence and dealing damage efficiently. By utilizing cards that cascade into other spells, the deck can quickly flood the board with threats while disrupting the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes elements of control and tempo, with cards like Force of Negation and Subtlety to help protect your creatures and maintain board advantage. Overall, the deck aims to be proactive and disruptive, pressuring the opponent to react and adapt to your game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing a variety of creature cards to create a toolbox style of gameplay, allowing the player to search for and play specific creatures as needed to achieve their combo strategy. The use of cards like Chord of Calling and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician, alongside creatures with powerful abilities such as Delighted Halfling and Grist, the Hunger Tide, enables the player to control the board and disrupt their opponent's game plan while steadily building towards a win condition.

This deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures that can be used to create powerful combos. The key strategy involves tutoring for specific creatures with cards like Chord of Calling and Eldritch Evolution, while also utilizing Yawgmoth, Thran Physician to generate value and control the board. The deck includes a mix of resilient creatures like Young Wolf and Wall of Roots, along with combo pieces like Grist, the Hunger Tide and Delighted Halfling. By carefully selecting and sequencing creatures, the deck can create powerful synergies and overwhelm opponents.

This deck focuses on utilizing the combo between Saheeli Rai and Felidar Guardian to create infinite creature tokens and win the game. The deck also uses cards like Wrenn and Six, Teferi, Time Raveler, and Leyline Binding to control the board and protect the combo. The mana base is designed to support the combo pieces and ensure smooth mana fixing. Overall, the key strategy is to quickly assemble the combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on using Indomitable Creativity to combo off by exchanging tokens for powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty. The main strategy is to protect your combo pieces with counterspells like Spell Pierce and disruption cards like Leyline Binding while utilizing planeswalkers like Wrenn and Six and Teferi, Time Raveler for control and advantage. The deck also includes card draw and removal spells to maintain board presence and handle threats. The goal is to win by quickly assembling the combo and overwhelming the opponent with high-impact creatures.

This deck focuses on assembling the Heliod combo, utilizing cards like Solitude and Walking Ballista for control and removal. The goal is to create a powerful board presence with Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Walking Ballista, supported by cards like Ranger-Captain of Eos and Esper Sentinel. Leyline Binding and Silence help protect the combo from disruption, while Agatha's Soul Cauldron provides additional utility. The mana base includes fetch lands and triomes to ensure consistent mana production. The key strategy is to establish the combo quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a strong board presence.

The deck focuses on using a combination of cards to quickly bring powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa onto the battlefield from the graveyard. It utilizes cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Goryo's Vengeance along with support spells like Ephemerate and Faithful Mending to accomplish this strategy. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Supreme Verdict to control the board while setting up its combo. Leyline Binding helps protect key pieces of the combo while cards like Tainted Indulgence and Thoughtseize disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The deck relies on cycling creatures and cascading spells to quickly fill the graveyard, then cast Living End to bring back powerful creatures and overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy is to carefully manage resources and timing to set up for a big Living End play that swings the game in your favor. This deck requires strategic sequencing and careful planning to maximize its explosive potential and take advantage of the powerful graveyard recursion provided by Living End. By efficiently cycling through your deck and controlling the board state, you can disrupt your opponent's game plan and secure victory through overwhelming board presence.

The deck focuses on quickly cycling through its cards to set up a powerful combo with Living End, which allows the player to return all creatures from their graveyard to the battlefield. By using cards like Shardless Agent, Generous Ent, and Grief to cascade into Living End, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a large number of creatures. The inclusion of disruptive elements like Force of Negation and Subtlety help protect the combo and control the game until the combo is set up. The deck also includes lands like Boseiju, Who Endures to improve the chances of resolving Living End successfully.

This Modern 1 vs 1 Merfolk deck focuses on utilizing the strength of Merfolk tribal synergy to quickly overwhelm opponents with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. By leveraging cards like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident to boost the power of Merfolk creatures and Aether Vial to cheat them into play, this deck aims to establish a dominant board presence early in the game. In addition, disruptive elements like Merfolk Trickster and Force of Negation are used to control the pace of the game and protect the deck's key creatures.

This Merfolk deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with low-cost creatures like Cenote Scout and Tide Shaper, buffing them with Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident. Merfolk Trickster provides disruption while Vodalian Hexcatcher and Tishana's Tidebinder control the opponent's board. Svyelun of Sea and Sky and Subtlety offer additional support. Aether Vial allows for quick creature deployment, while Spell Pierce and Force of Negation provide protection. The deck runs a mix of dual lands and fetch lands for mana fixing and consistency.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish board presence and apply pressure on the opponent by playing efficient creatures and disruptive spells. With a mix of powerful threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Dragon's Rage Channeler, alongside removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat, the deck aims to control the game and close it out as quickly as possible. The inclusion of counterspells and card draw spells helps to protect our creatures and maintain our game plan. The mana base is built to ensure consistency in casting our spells and utilizing the deck's powerful synergies.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on playing efficient threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Murktide Regent while disrupting opponents with spells like Counterspell and Spell Pierce. The deck also utilizes card selection and advantage through cards like Mishra's Bauble, Preordain, and Expressive Iteration. With a mix of cheap removal in Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent and close out the game quickly. The mana base supports the aggressive game plan with lands like Steam Vents and Scalding Tarn to ensure smooth mana development.
